Author: Elie Wiesel
Quote: The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference.

Author: Nicolas Chamfort
Quote: A day without laughter is a day wasted.

Author: Terry Johnson,  Insignificance
Quote: Have you ever noticed how ‘What the hell’ is always the right decision to make?

Author: Anne Frank,  Anne Frank's Tales from the Secret Annex
Quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.

Author: Margaret Mead
Quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts.

Author: Jonathan Swift
Quote: May you live every day of your life.

Author: May Sarton
Quote: We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: If a cluttered desk is a sign of a cluttered mind, of what, then, is an empty desk a sign?

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!

Author: Stephen Hawking
Quote: One, remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Two, never give up work. Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it. Three, if you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.

Author: Isaac Asimov,  Foundation
Quote: Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Hamlet
Quote: There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Hamlet
Quote: There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.

Author: Plato
Quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try!

Author: D.H. Lawrence,  Lady Chatterley's Lover
Quote: A woman has to live her life, or live to repent not having lived it.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well.

Author: Frank Zappa
Quote: Without deviation from the norm, progress is not possible.

Author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching
Quote: Simplicity, patience, compassion.These three are your greatest treasures.Simple in actions and thoughts, you return to the source of being.Patient with both friends and enemies,you accord with the way things are.Compassionate toward yourself,you reconcile all beings in the world.

Author: Elie Wiesel
Quote: There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest.

Author: Benjamin Spock
Quote: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.

Author: Albert Einstein,  The World As I See It
Quote: The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious. It is the fundamental emotion that stands at the cradle of true art and true science.

Author: Bertrand Russell
Quote: Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: Fantasy is escapist, and that is its glory. If a soldier is imprisioned by the enemy, don't we consider it his duty to escape?. . .If we value the freedom of mind and soul, if we're partisans of liberty, then it's our plain duty to escape, and to take as many people with us as we can!

Author: Richard Dawkins,  The God Delusion
Quote: We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.

Author: Malcolm X,  By Any Means Necessary
Quote: You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it.

Author: Markus Zusak,  I Am the Messenger
Quote: Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of.

Author: Douglas Adams,  Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency
Quote: Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all.

Author: Mo Willems,  Goldilocks and the Three Dinosaurs
Quote: If you ever find yourself in the wrong story, leave.

Author: Eckhart Tolle
Quote: The past has no power over the present moment.

Author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Quote: Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so.

Author: William Blake,  Auguries of Innocence
Quote: A truth that's told with bad intentBeats all the lies you can invent.

Author: George Bernard Shaw,  Man and Superman
Quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  The Great Gatsby
Quote: I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.

Author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Teh Ching
Quote: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.

Author: William S. Burroughs
Quote: A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on.

Author: Ian Fleming,  You Only Live Twice
Quote: You only live twice:Once when you are bornAnd once when you look death in the face

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This is the story my great-grandfather told my father, who then told my grandfather, who then told me about how The Mythical Mr. Boo, Charles Manseur Fizzlebush Grissham III, better known as Mr. Fizzlebush, and Orafoura are all in fact me...
Quote: Nothing, Everything, Anything, Something: If you have nothing, then you have everything, because you have the freedom to do anything, without the fear of losing something.

Author: John Keats,  Ode on a Grecian Urn and Other Poems
Quote: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard, are sweeter

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.

Author: Ludwig van Beethoven
Quote: Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: We are addicted to our thoughts. We cannot change anything if we cannot change our thinking.

Author: Socrates
Quote: I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think

Author: Gilles Deleuze,  A Thousand Plateaus: Capitalism and Schizophrenia
Quote: A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.

Author: Natalie Babbitt,  Tuck Everlasting
Quote: Like all magnificent things, it's very simple.

Author: Adolf Hitler
Quote: If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!

Author: Plato
Quote: The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  An Ideal Husband
Quote: Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  The Complete Prose Works of Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.

Author: Judy Blume
Quote: Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear.

Author: Patrick Ness,  A Monster Calls
Quote: You do not write your life with words...You write it with actions. What you think is not important. It is only important what you do.

Author: Charles M. Schulz
Quote: Sometimes I lie awake at night and I ask, "Is life a multiple choice test or is it a true or false test?"...Then a voice comes to me out of the dark and says, "We hate to tell you this but life is a thousand word essay.

Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
Quote: It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams.

Author: Confucius
Quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. "Can they be brought together?"This is a practical question. We must get down to it. "I despise intelligence"really means: "I cannot bear my doubts.

Author: Carl Sagan,  The Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark
Quote: Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.

Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
Quote: A serious and good philosophical work could be written consisting entirely of jokes.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Cat's Cradle
Quote: Tiger got to hunt, bird got to fly;Man got to sit and wonder 'why, why, why?'Tiger got to sleep, bird got to land;Man got to tell himself he understand.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: I would believe only in a God that knows how to dance.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Quote: Grown-ups never understand anything by themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them

Author: Plato
Quote: Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.

Author: Keith Richards,  Keith Richards: In His Own Words
Quote: If you're going to kick authority in the teeth, you might as well use two feet.

Author: Tamora Pierce,  In the Hand of the Goddess
Quote: You didn't kill him. He would have killed you, but you didn't kill him.""So? He was stupid. If I killed everyone who was stupid, I wouldn't have time to sleep.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
Quote: Is it possible, in the final analysis, for one human being to achieve perfect understanding of another?We can invest enormous time and energy in serious efforts to know another person, but in the end, how close can we come to that person's essence? We convince ourselves that we know the other person well, but do we really know anything important about anyone?

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince
Quote: Well, I must endure the presence of a few caterpillars if I wish to become acquainted with the butterflies.

Author: Confucius
Quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.

Author: Rollo May
Quote: It is an ironic habit of human beings to run faster when they have lost their way.

Author: Stephen Fry,  Moab Is My Washpot
Quote: It's not all bad. Heightened self-consciousness, apartness, an inability to join in, physical shame and self-loathing—they are not all bad. Those devils have been my angels. Without them I would never have disappeared into language, literature, the mind, laughter and all the mad intensities that made and unmade me.

Author: Socrates
Quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.

Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
Quote: For me, I am driven by two main philosophies: know more today about the world than I knew yesterday and lessen the suffering of others. You'd be surprised how far that gets you.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: The true man wants two things: danger and play. For that reason he wants woman, as the most dangerous plaything.

Author: Ayn Rand
Quote: The smallest minority on earth is the individual. Those who deny individual rights cannot claim to be defenders of minorities.

Author: Norton Juster,  The Phantom Tollbooth
Quote: Expect everything, I always say, and the unexpected never happens.

Author: Bill Hicks
Quote: Today a young man on acid realized that all matter is merely energy condensed to a slow vibration, that we are all one consciousness experiencing itself subjectively, there is no such thing as death, life is only a dream, and we are the imagination of ourselves. Heres Tom with the Weather.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: The day the power of love overrules the love of power, the world will know peace.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Quote: I shall look at you out of the corner of my eye, and you will say nothing. Words are the source of misunderstandings.

Author: José Martí
Quote: The first duty of a man is to think for himself

Author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged
Quote: I started my life with a single absolute: that the world was mine to shape in the image of my highest values and never to be given up to a lesser standard, no matter how long or hard the struggle.

Author: Thomas Jefferson
Quote: The legitimate powers of government extend to such acts only as are injurious to others. It does me no injury for my neighbor to say there are twenty gods or no god. It neither picks my pocket nor breaks my leg.

Author: Heraclitus,  Fragments
Quote: Time is a game played beautifully by children.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Great Listener Seeks Mute Women
Quote: Whether you live to be 50 or 100 makes no difference, if you made no difference in the world.

Author: Dylan Thomas,  Do Not Go Gentle Into That Good Night
Quote: Do not go gentle into that good night,Old age should burn and rave at close of day;Rage, rage against the dying of the light.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well.

Author: Harlan Ellison,  Paingod and Other Delusions
Quote: I know that pain is the most important thing in the universes. Greater than survival, greater than love, greater even than the beauty it brings about. For without pain, there can be no pleasure. Without sadness, there can be no happiness. Without misery there can be no beauty. And without these, life is endless, hopeless, doomed and damned. Adult. You have become adult.

Author: Milan Kundera,  The Unbearable Lightness Of Being
Quote: He suddenly recalled from Plato's Symposium: People were hermaphrodites until God split then in two, and now all the halves wander the world over seeking one another. Love is the longing for the half of ourselves we have lost.

Author: George Lucas,  The Star Wars Trilogy
Quote: No! Try not. Do, or do not. There is no try.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: The most incomprehensible thing about the world is that it is at all comprehensible.

Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
Quote: Man is a mystery. It needs to be unravelled, and if you spend your whole life unravelling it, don't say that you've wasted time. I am studying that mystery because I want to be a human being.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Should Have Renamed This
Quote: If you only had 48 hours left to live, would you spend it like you normally spend your weekends? If not, why spend 2/7th of your life wasting your free time? After all, free time isn’t free. Free time is the most expensive time you have, because nobody pays for it but you. But that also makes it the most valuable time you have, as you alone stand to reap the profits from spending it wisely.

Author: Alan W. Watts
Quote: Man suffers only because he takes seriously what the gods made for fun.

Author: Douglas Coupland,  The Gum Thief
Quote: I don't deserve a soul, yet I still have one. I know because it hurts.

Author: Babe Ruth
Quote: Every strike brings me closer to the next home run.

Author: Robert Anton Wilson,  Cosmic Trigger: Die letzten Geheimnisse der Illuminaten oder An den Grenzen des erweiterten Bewusstseins
Quote: belief is the death of intelligence.

Author: Lauren Oliver,  Before I Fall
Quote: I shiver, thinking how easy it is to be totally wrong about people-to see one tiny part of them and confuse it for the whole, to see the cause and think it's the effect or vice versa

Author: Woody Allen
Quote: If it turns out that there is a God...the worst that you can say about him is that basically he's an underachiever.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: If anyone tells you that a certain person speaks ill of you, do not make excuses about what is said of you but answer, "He was ignorant of my other faults, else he would not have mentioned these alone.

Author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching
Quote: If you understand others you are smart.If you understand yourself you are illuminated.If you overcome others you are powerful.If you overcome yourself you have strength.If you know how to be satisfied you are rich.If you can act with vigor, you have a will.If you don't lose your objectives you can be long-lasting.If you die without loss, you are eternal.

Author: Dan Millman,  Way of the Peaceful Warrior: A Book That Changes Lives
Quote: The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination.

Author: Albert Camus,  The Myth of Sisyphus and Other Essays
Quote: Man is always prey to his truths. Once he has admitted them, he cannot free himself from them.

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer
Quote: Happiness consists in frequent repetition of pleasure

Author: Karl Marx,  Eleven Theses on Feuerbach
Quote: The philosophers have only interpreted the world, in various ways. The point, however, is to change it.[These words are also inscribed upon his grave]

Author: Plato
Quote: One of the penalties of refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by your inferiors.

Author: Jostein Gaarder,  Sophie's World
Quote: Wisest is she who knows she does not know.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding... And could you keep your heart in wonder at the daily miracles of your life, your pain would not seem less wondrous than your joy

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Zahir
Quote: No one should ever ask themselves that: why am I unhappy? The question carries within it the virus that will destroy everything. If we ask that question, it means we want to find out what makes us happy. If what makes us happy is different from what we have now, then we must either change once and for all or stay as we are, feeling even more unhappy.

Author: Garth Stein,  The Art of Racing in the Rain
Quote: He died that day because his body had served its purpose. His soul had done what it came to do, learned what it came to learn, and then was free to leave.

Author: Daniel Keyes,  Flowers for Algernon
Quote: I don’t know what’s worse: to not know what you are and be happy, or to become what you’ve always wanted to be, and feel alone.

Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden
Quote: Things do not change; we change.

Author: Stephen Hawking,  A Brief History of Time
Quote: Even if there is only one possible unified theory, it is just a set of rules and equations. What is it that breathes fire into the equations and makes a universe for them to describe? The usual approach of science of constructing a mathematical model cannot answer the questions of why there should be a universe for the model to describe. Why does the universe go to all the bother of existing?

Author: Bertrand Russell
Quote: I would never die for my beliefs because I might be wrong.

Author: Orhan Pamuk,  My Name is Red
Quote: I don't want to be a tree; I want to be its meaning.

Author: George Orwell,  All Art is Propaganda: Critical Essays
Quote: On the whole human beings want to be good, but not too good, and not quite all the time.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: Take it moment by moment, and you will find that we are all, as I’ve said before, bugs in amber.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV,  The Dalai Lama: A Policy of Kindness: An Anthology of Writings By and About the Dalai Lama
Quote: This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness.

Author: Malcolm X
Quote: You show me a capitalist, and I'll show you a bloodsucker

Author: Fulton J. Sheen,  Seven Words of Jesus and Mary: Lessons from Cana and Calvary
Quote: It takes three to make love, not two: you, your spouse, and God. Without God people only succeed in bringing out the worst in one another. Lovers who have nothing else to do but love each other soon find there is nothing else. Without a central loyalty life is unfinished.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: Some people talk in their sleep. Lecturers talk while other people sleep

Author: Michel Foucault,  Madness and Civilization: A History of Insanity in the Age of Reason
Quote: People know what they do; frequently they know why they do what they do; but what they don't know is what what they do does.

Author: George S. Patton Jr.
Quote: It is foolish and wrong to mourn the men who died. Rather, we should thank God that such men lived.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: Know thyself? If I knew myself, I'd run away.

Author: Woody Guthrie
Quote: Take it easy, but take it.

Author: Hanh Nhat Thich,  The Heart of the Buddha's Teaching: Transforming Suffering into Peace, Joy, and Liberation
Quote: The seed of suffering in you may be strong, but don't wait until you have no more suffering before allowing yourself to be happy.

Author: Dan Millman,  Way of the Peaceful Warrior: A Book That Changes Lives
Quote: There are no ordinary moments.

Author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged
Quote: Devotion to the truth is the hallmark of morality; there is no greater, nobler, more heroic form of devotion than the act of a man who assumes the responsibility of thinking.

Author: Hans Urs von Balthasar,  Prayer
Quote: What you are is God's gift to you, what you become is your gift to God.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  Flight to Arras
Quote: No single event can awaken within us a stranger whose existence we had never suspected. To live is to be slowly born.

Author: Lao Tzu,  Te Tao Ching
Quote: The flame that burns Twice as bright burns half as long.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Palm Sunday: An Autobiographical Collage
Quote: Anyway—because we are readers, we don't have to wait for some communications executive to decide what we should think about next—and how we should think about it. We can fill our heads with anything from aardvarks to zucchinis—at any time of night or day.

Author: Carl Sagan,  Broca's Brain: Reflections on the Romance of Science
Quote: But the fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses. They laughed at Columbus, they laughed at Fulton, they laughed at the Wright brothers. But they also laughed at Bozo the Clown.

Author: James Baldwin,  Giovanni's Room
Quote: Perhaps home is not a place but simply an irrevocable condition.

Author: Agatha Christie
Quote: If you place your head in a lion's mouth, then you cannot complain one day if he happens to bite it off.

Author: Jacqueline Carey,  Kushiel's Dart
Quote: All knowledge is worth having.

Author: George Orwell,  1984
Quote: For, after all, how do we know that two and two make four? Or that the force of gravity works? Or that the past is unchangeable? If both the past and the external world exist only in the mind, and if the mind itself is controllable – what then?

Author: Norton Juster,  The Phantom Tollbooth
Quote: The most important reason for going from one place to another is to see what's in between, and they took great pleasure in doing just that.

Author: Robert A. Heinlein,  The Moon is a Harsh Mistress
Quote: There ain't no such thing as a free lunch.

Author: Ludwig van Beethoven
Quote: Don’t only practice your art, but force your way into its secrets, for it and knowledge can raise men to the divine.

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
Quote: It does not matter how long you are spending on the earth, how much money you have gathered or how much attention you have received. It is the amount of positive vibration you have radiated in life that matters,

Author: D.H. Lawrence,  Lady Chatterley's Lover
Quote: It's no good trying to get rid of your own aloneness. You've got to stick to it all your life. Only at times, at times, the gap will be filled in. At times! But you have to wait for the times. Accept your own aloneness and stick to it, all your life. And then accept the times when the gap is filled in, when they come. But they've got to come. You can't force them.

Author: Stephen Fry
Quote: Stop feeling sorry for yourself and you will be happy.

Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
Quote: I don't know why we are here, but I'm pretty sure that it is not in order to enjoy ourselves.

Author: Robertson Davies,  Tempest-Tost
Quote: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.

Author: Slavoj Žižek
Quote: Cinema is the ultimate pervert art. It doesn't give you what you desire - it tells you how to desire.

Author: Stephen King
Quote: Fault always lies in the same place: with him weak enough to lay blame.

Author: Heinrich Heine
Quote: We should forgive our enemies, but not before they are hanged

Author: Alan W. Watts
Quote: You are an aperture through which the universe is looking at and exploring itself.

Author: T.S. Eliot,  Poems: 1909-1925
Quote: We are the hollow menWe are the stuffed menLeaning togetherHeadpiece filled with straw. Alas!Our dried voices, whenWe whisper togetherAre quiet and meaninglessAs wind in dry grassOr rats' feet over broken glassIn our dry cellarShape without form, shade without colour,Paralysed force, gesture without motion;- The Hollow Men

Author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close
Quote: Feathers filled the small room. Our laughter kept the feathers in the air. I thought about birds. Could they fly is there wasn't someone, somewhere, laughing?

Author: Tom Wolfe
Quote: A cult is a religion with no political power.

Author: Vladimir Lenin
Quote: Freedom in capitalist society always remains about the same as it was in ancient Greek republics: Freedom for slave owners.

Author: Bertrand Russell,  The Philosophy of Logical Atomism
Quote: My desire and wish is that the things I start with should be so obvious that you wonder why I spend my time stating them. This is what I aim at because the point of philosophy is to start with something so simple as not to seem worth stating, and to end with something so paradoxical that no one will believe it.

Author: Alan W. Watts
Quote: The menu is not the meal.

Author: Christopher Paolini,  Brisingr
Quote: Perhaps not one religion contains all of the truth of the world. Perhaps every religion contains fragments of the truth, and it is our responsibility to identify those fragments and piece them together.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.

Author: Hermann Hesse,  Siddhartha
Quote: It may be important to great thinkers to examine the world, to explain and despise it. But I think it is only important to love the world, not to despise it, not for us to hate each other, but to be able to regard the world and ourselves and all beings with love, admiration and respect.

Author: Niccolò Machiavelli,  The Prince
Quote: The first method for estimating the intelligence of a ruler is to look at the men he has around him.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.

Author: Edith Södergran
Quote: The inner fire is the most important thing mankind possesses.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: The most perfidious way of harming a cause consists of defending it deliberately with faulty arguments.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: Au milieu de l'hiver, j'ai découvert en moi un invincible été.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Two Towers
Quote: Fair speech may hide a foul heart.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: The Revolution introduced me to art, and in turn, art introduced me to the Revolution!

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: The evil that is in the world almost always comes from ignorance, and good intentions may do as much harm as malevolence if they lack understanding.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: I have gained this by philosophy … I do without being ordered what some are constrained to do by their fear of the law.

Author: Leon Trotsky,  Their Morals and Ours
Quote: The end may justify the means as long as there is something that justifies the end.

Author: Noam Chomsky
Quote: I was never aware of any other option but to question everything.

Author: Masashi Kishimoto
Quote: When a man learns to love, he must bear the risk of hatred.

Author: George Carlin
Quote: I think I am, therefore, I am... I think.

Author: Bertrand Russell,  A History of Western Philosophy
Quote: To teach how to live without certainty, and yet without being paralyzed by hesitation, is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy, in our age, can still do for those who study it.

Author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird
Quote: Before I can live with other folks I’ve got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn’t abide by majority rule is a person’s conscience.

Author: Aberjhani,  Elemental: The Power of Illuminated Love
Quote: The words ‘I Love You’ kill, and resurrect millions, in less than a second.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Our love went from fly to flower to butterfly, and it was meant to beautifully flutter, not sit still on a shelf like a trophy to be collected.

Author: Lisa Lutz,  The Spellmans Strike Again
Quote: Our ability to adapt is amazing. Our ability to change isn't quite as spectacular.

Author: Socrates,  Essential Thinkers - Socrates
Quote: Contentment is natural wealth, luxury is artificial poverty.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist
Quote: When someone sees the same people every day, as had happened with him at the seminary, they wind up becoming a part of that person's life. And then they want the person to change. If someone isn't what others want them to be, the others become angry. Everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, but none about his or her own.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: To write well, express yourself like the common people, but think like a wise man.

Author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged
Quote: Who is John Galt?

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: When another blames you or hates you, or people voice similar criticisms, go to their souls, penetrate inside and see what sort of people they are. You will realize that there is no need to be racked with anxiety that they should hold any particular opinion about you.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Love now, not later. Also, love later.

Author: Nicholas Tharcher,  Rebels and Devils: The Psychology of Liberation
Quote: The essence of independence has been to think and act according to standards from within, not without: to follow one's own path, not that of the crowd.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I had a second friend come over to my house, and do you know what I called her? A refill. If relationships aren’t drinkable, why do we thirst for them so much?

Author: Carl Sagan
Quote: I consider it an extremely dangerous doctrine, because the more likely we are to assume that the solution comes from the outside, the less likely we are to solve our problems ourselves.

Author: Wil Zeus,  Sun Beyond the Clouds
Quote: Always forgive, but never forget, else you will be a prisoner of your own hatred, and doomed to repeat your mistakes forever.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Wanderer
Quote: If you reveal your secrets to the wind,you should not blame the wind forrevealing them to the trees.

Author: Arthur Miller,  The Crucible
Quote: Until an hour before the Devil fell, God thought him beautiful in Heaven.

Author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged
Quote: I never found beauty in longing for the impossible and never found the possible to be beyond my reach.

Author: Sun Tzu
Quote: Even the finest sword plunged into salt water will eventually rust.

Author: Carl Sagan
Quote: The cosmos is within us. We are made of star-stuff. We are a way for the universe to know itself.

Author: William James
Quote: A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices.

Author: Epicurus
Quote: Death, therefore, the most awful of evils, is nothing to us, seeing that, when we are, death is not come, and, when death is come, we are not.

Author: Nicholas Tharcher,  Rebels and Devils: The Psychology of Liberation
Quote: Inevitably it follows that anyone with an independent mind must become 'one who resists or opposes an authority or established convention': a rebel. ...And if enough people come to agree with—and follow—the REBEL, we now have a DEVIL. Until, of course, still more people agree. And then, finally, we have ... GREATNESS.

Author: Heraclitus,  Fragments
Quote: Even a soul submerged in sleep is hard at work and helps make something of the world.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: Words do not express thoughts very well; every thing immediately becomes a little different, a little distorted, a little foolish. And yet it also pleases me and seems right that what is of value and wisdom of one man seems nonsense to another.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Nothing carries meaning. People carry meaning. We are the porters of importance.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Wintersmith
Quote: The trouble is you can shut your eyes but you can’t shut your mind.

Author: William Blake
Quote: The glory of Christianity is to conquer by forgiveness.

Author: Baruch Spinoza
Quote: The highest activity a human being can attain is learning for understanding, because to understand is to be free.

Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Left Hand of Darkness
Quote: The only thing that makes life possible is permanent, intolerable uncertainty: not knowing what comes next.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  The Great Gatsby
Quote: Life is much more successfully looked at from a single window.

Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein,  Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus
Quote: Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent.

Author: Philip Pullman,  The Amber Spyglass
Quote: When you choose one way out of many, all the ways you don't take are snuffed out like candles, as if they'd never existed.

Author: Epictetus,  The Art of Living: The Classical Manual on Virtue, Happiness and Effectiveness
Quote: Don't just say you have read books. Show that through them you have learned to think better, to be a more discriminating and reflective person. Books are the training weights of the mind. They are very helpful, but it would be a bad mistake to suppose that one has made progress simply by having internalized their contents."Translation by Sharon Lebell

Author: Maya Angelou,  Wouldn't Take Nothing for My Journey Now
Quote: Living well is an art that can be developed: a love of life and ability to take great pleasure from small offerings and assurance that the world owes you nothing and that every gift is exactly that, a gift.

Author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged: 35th Anniversary Edition
Quote: I think, therefore I'll think.

Author: Jean-Paul Sartre
Quote: He was free, free in every way, free to behave like a fool or a machine, free to accept, free to refuse, free to equivocate; to marry, to give up the game, to drag this death weight about with him for years to come. He could do what he liked, no one had the right to advise him, there would be for him no Good or Evil unless he thought them into being.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: I assess the power of a will by how much resistance, pain, torture it endures and knows how to turn to its advantage

Author: Jostein Gaarder,  The Solitaire Mystery
Quote: When you realize there is something you don't understand, then you're generally on the right path to understanding all kinds of things.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: Seize the moments of happiness, love and be loved! That is the only reality in the world, all else is folly. It is the one thing we are interested in here.

Author: Plato
Quote: In politics we presume that everyone who knows how to get votes knows how to administer a city or a state. When we are ill... we do not ask for the handsomest physician, or the most eloquent one.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I’ve got a nice racket going. I make tennis ball swatters. My favorite score is love all. That’s also how I live my life.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: Challenges are gifts that force us to search for a new center of gravity. Don't fight them. Just find a new way to stand.

Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden
Quote: Only that day dawns to which we are awake. There is more day to dawn. The sun is but a morning star.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Aleph
Quote: Travel is never a matter of money but of courage

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet

Author: Brent Weeks,  The Way of Shadows
Quote: Do you know what punishments I've endured for my crimes, my sins? None. I am proof of the absurdity of men's most treasured abstractions. A just universe wouldn't tolerate my existence.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Quote: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Non est ad astra mollis e terris via"- "There is no easy way from the earth to the stars

Author: Scott Adams
Quote: Dance like it hurts. Love like you need money. Work when people are watching. -- Dogbert's Motto

Author: Maria Cristina Mena,  The Collected Stories of Maria Cristina Mena
Quote: The pianokeys are black and whitebut they sound like a million colors in your mind

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Now that I’m 33.3 years old, the days of blue and green are behind me. I have left the earthy and entered into the purple phase of my life.

Author: Jean-Paul Sartre,  Being and Nothingness
Quote: It is therefore senseless to think of complaining since nothing foreign has decided what we feel, what we live, or what we are.

Author: Alice Walker,  The Color Purple
Quote: I think us here to wonder, myself. To wonder. To ask. And that in wondering bout the big things and asking bout the big things, you learn about the little ones, almost by accident. But you never know nothing more about the big things than you start out with. The more I wonder, the more I love.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Simone de Beauvoir
Quote: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, and compassion

Author: Melissa Marr,  Fragile Eternity
Quote: Choose to be happy. It is what we have all done.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  Mirrors of the Soul
Quote: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.

Author: Sophocles
Quote: One must wait until the evening to see how splendid the day has been.

Author: Richard Feynman
Quote: Physics isn't the most important thing. Love is.

Author: Alain de Botton
Quote: The moment we cry in a film is not when things are sad but when they turn out to be more beautiful than we expected them to be.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: Doing nothing is better than being busy doing nothing.

Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
Quote: The real question of life after death isn't whether or not it exists, but even if it does what problem this really solves.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I'm all for all for one, especially when I'm the one. That's my philosophy when the dinner bill arrives at the table.

Author: David Foster Wallace,  Brief Interviews with Hideous Men
Quote: Everything takes time. Bees have to move very fast to stay still.

Author: Joseph Brodsky
Quote: Life—the way it really is—is a battle not between good and bad, but between bad and worse

Author: Fulton J. Sheen,  Seven Words of Jesus and Mary: Lessons from Cana and Calvary

Author: David Hume,  A Treatise of Human Nature

Author: Alice Bag,  Violence Girl: East L.A. Rage to Hollywood Stage, a Chicana Punk Story
Quote: What a waste my life would be without all the beautiful mistakes I've made.

Author: Immanuel Kant,  An Answer to the Question: What Is Enlightenment?

Self-incurred is this tutelage when its cause lies not in lack of reason but in lack of resolution and courage to use it without direction from another. Sapere aude! 'Have courage to use your own reason!'- that is the motto of enlightenment.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Just when you thought you’d considered all the angles, life goes from a square to a cube. Love should also be 3D.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who overcomes his enemies.

Author: Frank Herbert,  Dune
Quote: There is no escape—we pay for the violence of our ancestors.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Tom Robbins,  Still Life with Woodpecker

Author: Frank Herbert,  Children of Dune

And as the aristocracy develops, government tends more and more to act exclusively in the interests of the ruling class -- whether that class be hereditary royalty, oligarchs of financial empires, or entrenched bureaucracy.

Author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos
Quote: The beauty of a living thing is not the atoms that go into it, but the way those atoms are put together.

Author: Søren Kierkegaard,  Fear and Trembling

Author: Bernhard Schlink,  The Reader

I will be the only angel you need. You will leave life even more beautiful than you entered it. Heaven will take you back and look at you and say: Only one thing can make a soul complete and that thing is love.

Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
Quote: I am my world.

Author: Malcolm X

Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
Quote: My view is that if your philosophy is not unsettled daily then you are blind to all the universe has to offer.

Author: René Descartes

I believe that body, shape, extension, motion, location are functions. What is there then that can be taken as true? Perhaps only this one thing, that nothing at all is certain.

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry

Author: François de La Rochefoucauld
Quote: True love is like ghosts, which everybody talks about and few have seen.

Author: Leon Trotsky
Quote: Everything is relative in this world, where change alone endures.

Author: Zhuangzi,  The Butterfly as Companion: Meditations on the First Three Chapters of the Chuang-Tzu

I was conscious only of my happiness as a butterfly, unaware that I was myself. Soon I awaked, and there I was, veritably myself again. Now I do not know whether I was then a man dreaming I was a butterfly, or whether I am now a butterfly, dreaming I am a man.

Author: Michel de Montaigne,  The Complete Essays
Quote: Learned we may be with another man's learning: we can only be wise with wisdom of our own.

Author: Graham Parke,  Unspent Time
Quote: I'm very polite by nature, even the voices in my head let each other finish their sentences.

Author: Dale Carnegie
Quote: It isn't what you have, or who you are, or where you are, or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about.

Author: Blaise Pascal,  Pensées
Quote: To make light of philosophy is to be a true philosopher.

Author: Robert Elias
Quote: If you can't fight and you can't flee, flow.

Author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo

Author: Philip K. Dick

Author: Jacqueline Carey,  Kushiel's Chosen
Quote: All paths are present, always... and we can but choose among them.

Author: Adam Smith

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche,  Beyond Good and Evil
Quote: Madness is something rare in individuals — but in groups, parties, peoples, and ages, it is the rule.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: I cannot compromise my respect for your love. You can keep your love, I will keep my respect.

Author: Baruch Spinoza
Quote: I do not know how to teach philosophy without becoming a disturber of the peace.

Author: Ovid,  Metamorphoses
Quote: Fas est ab hoste doceri.One should learn even from one's enemies.

Author: Vladimir Lenin

Author: Isaac Newton
Quote: Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer,  Parerga and Paralipomena

Author: Niccolò Machiavelli,  The Prince

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: If a thing is worth doing, it is worth doing badly.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: Look back over the past, with its changing empires that rose and fell, and you can foresee the future too.

Author: Robert Anton Wilson,  Cosmic Trigger: Die letzten Geheimnisse der Illuminaten oder An den Grenzen des erweiterten Bewusstseins

Author: Jostein Gaarder,  The Solitaire Mystery

Author: Wendelin Van Draanen,  Flipped

Author: Frank Herbert,  Dune

Author: Hanh Nhat Thich,  Buddha Mind, Buddha Body: Walking Toward Enlightenment

Author: Alan W. Watts,  The Book on the Taboo Against Knowing Who You Are

Author: Aberjhani,  Visions of a Skylark Dressed in Black
Quote: You were born a child of light’s wonderful secret— you return to the beauty you have always been.

Author: Aristotle,  On Man in the Universe
Quote: All men by nature desire knowledge.

Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
Quote: God is an ever receding pocket of scientific ignorance.

Author: Anonymous,  The New Testament

Author: Elie Wiesel,  Night

He has no right to deprive future generations of a past that belongs to our collective memory. To forget would be not only dangerous but offensive; to forget the dead would be akin to killing them a second time.

Author: Fulton J. Sheen

Author: Catherynne M. Valente,  The Girl Who Circumnavigated Fairyland in a Ship of Her Own Making
Quote: Do not ruin today with mourning tomorrow.

Author: H.L. Mencken,  A Little Book in C Major

Author: Epicurus
Quote: He who is not satisfied with a little, is satisfied with nothing .

Author: Jean-Paul Sartre,  Existentialism Is a Humanism
Quote: Il n'y a de réalité que dans l'action.(There is no reality except in action.)

Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  The Sirens of Titan
Quote: The bounties of space, of infinite outwardness, were three: empty heroics, low comedy, and pointless death.

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
Quote: Each star is a mirror reflecting the truth inside you.

Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Author: Aberjhani,  Visions of a Skylark Dressed in Black
Quote: What a lover’s heart knows let no man’s brain dispute.

Author: Voltaire

Author: David Mitchell,  Cloud Atlas

Author: Lao Tzu

Author: Dale Carnegie

Author: Slavoj Žižek

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: I am one thing, my writings are another.

Author: Quentin R. Bufogle
Quote: If you're gonna burn a bridge behind you, make sure you've crossed it first.

Author: Philip Pullman,  The Amber Spyglass

Author: Suzanne Gordon
Quote: To be alone is to be different, to be different is to be alone.

Author: Carroll Bryant
Quote: The moment you stop trying to become a better person, is the moment you start to become worse than what you already are.

Author: Jostein Gaarder,  Sophie's World

Author: Henri Bergson
Quote: To exist is to change, to change is to mature, to mature is to go on creating oneself endlessly.

Author: Michel de Montaigne,  The Complete Essays
Quote: There is nothing more notable in Socrates than that he found time, when he was an old man, to learn music and dancing, and thought it time well spent.

Author: Frédéric Bastiat
Quote: The state is that great fiction by which everyone tries to live at the expense of everyone else.

Author: Rumi

Author: Seneca
Quote: No man was ever wise by chance

Author: Ayn Rand
Quote: I can accept anything, except what seems to be the easiest for most people: the half-way, the almost, the just-about, the in-between.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: Jokes of the proper kind, properly told, can do more to enlighten questions of politics, philosophy, and literature than any number of dull arguments.

Author: Alfred Bester,  The Stars My Destination

Author: Emil Cioran
Quote: Knowledge subverts love: in proportion as we penetrate our secrets, we come to loathe our kind, precisely because they resemble us.

Author: David Levithan,  Nick & Norah's Infinite Playlist

Author: Alan W. Watts,  The Wisdom of Insecurity: A Message for an Age of Anxiety
Quote: What we have forgotten is that thoughts and words are conventions, and that it is fatal to take conventions too seriously. A convention is a social convenience, as, for example, money ... but it is absurd to take money too seriously, to confuse it with real wealth ... In somewhat the same way, thoughts, ideas and words are "coins"for real things.

Author: James Madison
Quote: Philosophy is common sense with big words.

Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein,  On Certainty

Author: René Descartes
Quote: Except our own thoughts, there is nothing absolutely in our power.

Author: Erma Bombeck
Quote: Dreams have only one owner at a time. That's why dreamers are lonely.

Author: Epicurus
Quote: The wealth required by nature is limited and is easy to procure; but the wealth required by vain ideals extends to infinity.

Author: K.L. Toth
Quote: One of the greatest tragedies in life is to lose your own sense of self and accept the version of you that is expected by everyone else.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: As soon as you have made a thought, laugh at it.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Plato was a bore.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: All great things must first wear terrifying and monstrous masks, in order to inscribe themselves on the hearts of humanity.

Author: Ayn Rand,  Atlas Shrugged
Quote: I take no pride in hopeless longing; I wouldn't hold a stillborn aspiration. I'd want to have it, to make it, to live it.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.

Author: O.R. Melling,  The Summer King

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: If a man has character, he has also his typical experience, which always recurs.

Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
Quote: To study philosophy is nothing but to prepare one’s self to die.

Author: David Eddings,  King of the Murgos
Quote: ...only in the surrender of the light could the darkness prevail.

Author: Stephen King,  The Shining
Quote: This inhuman place makes human monsters.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: it is all very well for you to write simply and the simpler the better. But do not start to think so damned simply. Know how complicated it is and then state it simply.

Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
Quote: Not how the world is, but that it is, is the mystery.

Author: Amit Ray,  World Peace: The Voice of a Mountain Bird
Quote: A bird is safe in its nest - but that is not what its wings are made for.

Author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn,  Cancer Ward
Quote: The meaning of earthly existence lies not, as we have grown used to thinking, in prospering but in the development of the soul.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: You say, it's dark. And in truth, I did place a cloud before your sun. But do you not see how the edges of the cloud are already glowing and turning light.

Author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo
Quote: To learn is not to know; there are the learners and the learned. Memory makes the one, philosophy the others.

Author: Robert A. Heinlein,  Stranger in a Strange Land
Quote: If you've got the truth you can demonstrate it. Talking doesn't prove it.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: The life of the enemy . Whoever lives for the sake of combating an enemy has an interest in the enemy's staying alive.

Author: Cindy Ross
Quote: Returning home is the most difficult part of long-distance hiking; You have grown outside the puzzle and your piece no longer fits.

Author: Alfred Korzybski
Quote: The map is not the territory.

Author: Marilyn Manson

Author: Albert Camus

Author: Ken Kesey,  One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Quote: They can't tell so much about you if you got your eyes closed.

Author: Robert A. Heinlein,  Have Space Suit—Will Travel

Author: Jostein Gaarder,  The Solitaire Mystery
Quote: Our lives are part of a unique adventure... Nevertheless, most of us think the world is 'normal' and are constantly hunting for something abnormal--like angels or Martians. But that is just because we don't realize the world is a mystery. As for myself, I felt completely different. I saw the world as an amazing dream. I was hunting for some kind of explanation of how everything fit together.

Author: Heraclitus,  Fragments
Quote: Whoever cannot seek the unforeseen sees nothing for the known way is an impasse.

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: Who is wise? He that learns from everyone. Who is powerful? He that governs his passions. Who is rich? He that is content. Who is that? Nobody.

Author: Niccolò Machiavelli,  Prince
Quote: A prudent man should always follow in the path trodden by great men and imitate those who are most excellent, so that if he does not attain to their greatness, at any rate he will get some tinge of it.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: To be a philosopher is not merely to have subtle thoughts, nor even to found a school, but so to love wisdom as to live according to its dictates, a life of simplicity, independence, magnanimity and trust.

Author: David Hume
Quote: Reason is, and ought only to be the slave of the passions.

Author: Bertrand Russell
Quote: Anything you're good at contributes to happiness.

Author: Hazrat Inayat Khan
